You lifted it up and found it to be deceptively light but no lighter than eight pounds at least. "This'll do," you said to yourself before charging at the lizard. "Hey scale face!" You shouted as you neared her, the lizard halted her assault and turned to face you just as you'd begun to swing the pipe like a bat. The pipe slammed into the reptiles side causing her to clench and waiver, but she stayed standing. You responded by spinning three hundred and sixty degrees and striking her again, this time in the stomach causing her to gasp, but nothing more.

         Faster than you could react she struck you with a backhanded slap across your face. You were stunned, that 'slap' felt like someone took a two-by-four and a Razer to your face at the same time. The impact physically lifted you off of the ground and carried you a few feet away before landing you on your back. You groaned in pain and tried to stand, but you found it nearly impossible to do so with your neck and head hurting so much. You could hear the reptile lady coming your way. "I've got to get up! She's gonna get me!"

         As the lizard knelt down and began reaching for you, Sadie's voice pierced the air, "Dont you touch him!" She shouted. The lizard turned around with an arrogant expression expecting Sadie to be shakily holding onto the wall for support. But instead, she found her bringing her fist up for an uppercut. Sadie's fist connected with the lizard woman's jaw sending he'd staggering backwards, but before she got too far away Sadie grabbed her by the wrist and swung her face first into the wall before kicking her legs out from under her and slamming her into the ground on her back. Showing no signs of resistance, the lizard lay limp on the floor, prompting Sadie to rush to you. "Are you okay?" She asked as she helped you back onto your feet.
13533222111212.title: Street Fight In Space

choices: In and out of consciousness
When you wake
135332221112121.content:
"Aside from the intense pain in my neck and face, I think I'm ok," You reply as you take a couple of steps to test your balance.

         "Well that's good news," Sadie sighed, "But just to be safe, I'm going to check you out when we get back to the ship. Just to make sure you're as fine as you say you are."

         "You're, going to give me a medical examination?" You asked incredulously, "But I thought you were a mechanic."

         Sadie gave a mock huff and crossed her arms, "What? Just because I fix machines I can't fix people?"

         You honestly weren't sure how to respond to that. Sadie then moved to pick up her gun, but as she did, you noticed the male lizard was still somewhat conscious and taking aim with his own gun. The weapon wasn't trained on you though, it was aimed at Sadie. Just before the trigger was squeezed you threw yourself in front of the beam. When it hit you, it felt like you were being electricuted, burned and frozen all at once. When it finally stopped, you fell to the ground, you tried to move your hand but your foot twitched instead. You tried to sit up but nothing happened, a tingling sensation ran down your spine. You vaguely heard three shots fired before you passed out....
135332221112121.title: Surprise motherf- you can figure out the rest

choices: Tammy and the others arrive
There's a sharp jolt that shakes the ship
1353322211121212.content:
You woke up gasping for air before you realized how much pain you were in. "Augh!" You clutched yourself and cringed as pain surged through you.

         "Easy! You're still recovering!" Sadie called as she placed a paw on your back and another on your shoulder before easing you back into a reclined position. Once you were down Sadie moved to a control panel, "He's awake," she stated.

         That's voice cane over the intercom, "We're on our way."

         You glanced around the room and found yourself laying on one of three beds. They were all neatly made with thick padding and blankets. Each one had what looked like surgical lights above them and computer consoles near each one. "Where am I?" You wondered aloud.

         "In our infirmary, aboard the Star Runner," Sadie answered as she came over to the bed you were on. "How do you feel?"

         "Terrible..." You admitted, "But I'm alive."

         "And I wouldn't be if you hadn't put yourself in harm's way," Sadie replied, "Why did you do that? You could've been killed!"

         "It seemed like the right thing to do?" You reply unsure of your answer. You don't regret what you did, nor did you question why you did it... But... your not really sure what that reason was.

         "Well thank you, that was a neural destabalizer. Had that hit me, I would have been down for weeks since I wouldn't have been able to treat myself and the others wouldn't have known how to treat me," she explained. You opened your mouth to reply but Sadie cut you off before you could, "-But don't go thinking this makes it ok for you to go running around putting yourself in danger... got it?" You quietly nodded. "I'd hate to lose the newest member of our crew to recklessness."
1353322211121212.title: Medicine and Conversation

choices: skip ahead a day or two
Skip to the next adventure
13533222111212121.content:
The rest of the girls walk in not long after Sadie's little lecture. Riley comes to your bedside right away while Tammy and your other shipmates discussed your medical condition.

         "Are you alright?" Riley asked, concern was plainly written on her face.

         "I think so," You replied to her. For the most part you felt fine. But you did have a pretty bad headache and your mind felt a little hazy.

         Riley sighed in relief, "I'm glad you're okay. I was worried that we might not ever see you again."

         Rita also approached you from behind, "Sorry about what happened back there. I knew those guys were sleazy, but I never thought that they would try something like that. But I guess humans are a rarity out here, and not many species have ever seen one."


         "I suppose that makes me valuable," You mused.

         "Perhaps," Rita noted, "But whatever value you held to them couldn't have compared to how valuable you are to us."

         Rita's words cause you to smile a little and blush. This doesn't go unnoticed by Tammy. "D'aaw, look! He's blushing over what Rita said! This is so cute and adorable, but mostly because he's embarrassed!"

         "Oh shutup!" You snapped.

         "Oh! Looks like I was spot on about him being embarassed," Tammy chuckled.

         "Seriously Tammy, knock it off..." You beg. But this only eggs her on more and more.

         "Or what short stack? You'll blush some more?" Tammy laughed.

         "Riley was going to say something to Tammy when you surprised the whole group by launching yourself off of the table and into Tammy. The panther stumbled backwards before falling over onto the floor and landed on her back with you sitting on her stomach. However, you were still recovering and quickly remembered this as pain rolled throughout your body. You rolled off of Tammy and groaned in pain.

         Tammy was also in pain as she clutched the back of her head and hissed. The two of you lay side by side while groaning on the floor. Riley covered her mouth and gasped while Sadie shook her head and sighed, "I'll go get the first aid kit," Sadie muttered.

         Rita chuckled to herself as she watched you and Riley writhing on the ground, "I think he'll fit in just fine here," She said with a smile.
13533222111212121.title: Tammy and the others arrive

choices: It's uneventful and you talk in the mess hall afterwards
The ship starts shaking violently
135332221112121211.content:
Your alarm clock blared at 0800. You groaned and rolled over swatting the air before you remembered that you didn't have to do that anymore. "Alarm off," You mumbled. The alarm stopped almost immediately. You loved that feature, it was one of the highlights of living in space as far as you were concerned. You sat up and swung your feet out of bed before stretching and heading to your bathroom. You quickly showered and changed clothes before heading out of your room.

         You only made it a few feet before you nearly walked right into Sadie. Being the smallest member of the crew Sadie was only about a head taller than you. It made most of your interaction easy with her because she was around your size as far as height went.

         "Oh! Sorry Kyle! I was just stopping by to see if you could lend me a hand in the engine room," She explained.

         "Sure, you replied," As you followed her down the hall.

         "So how are you adjusting to life on a spaceship?" She askedas she looked back at you.

         "It's certainly different than what I know," You admitted, "But I think I'm getting the hang of it."

         "I have to say the girls and I are impressed that you've managed to break into such a different lifstyle so quickly. Not alot of humans are able to do it," Sadie noted.

         "I'll be happy as long as I don't end up flushing myself into space," You joked.

         Sadie laughed, "I think you're intelligent enough to avoid that."

         Before long you were entering the engine room. There were four cylinders sticking out from a wall with hoses, pipes, computer consoles and wiring conduits. Above all four of the giant cylinders was a catwalk where you and Sadie stood.

         "So what did you need me to do?" You asked.

         "The engines have been running rather hot lately. So I was hoping you could help me take some readings. I'm going to inject higher concentrations of coolant into each one, but I can't inject the coolant and be at the console to see the results at the same time," She explained.

         "Okay, so which one do you want to start on?" You asked.

         "We'll start on engine one at the far left and work our way over," She replied.

         The next hour consisted of Sadie climbing on top of each engine and injecting coolant into them while you stood at the bottom and called out numbers to her.
135332221112121211.title: The daily grind

choices: Go have a look around
Isn't that panel by the door supposed to be able to contact the bridge?
1353322211121212112.content:
"Was that our fault?" You ask as you look up at Sadie.

         "If it was our fault we probably wouldn't be here to talk about it," Sadie noted. Another violent jolt rattled the ship causing you to fall over. You didn't have far to fall though as Sadie caught you in her arms. Once she was sure you were alright she ran over to the ladder and beckoned for you to climb up ahead of her. You both safely reached the catwalk. In the blink of an eye Sadie was at a panel by the door where she contacted the bridge.

         "What is going on up there?" She demanded.

         "We don't know, some weird ship just came out of nowhere and started firing on us!" Tammy replied.

         "Kyle, go to your room," Sadie ordered.

         "But I wanna help!"

         "Now! No arguments!" Sadie sternly ordered.

         You'd never seen her get that angry before. It was actually kind of scary. You quietly did as you were told and ran back to your room. It wasn't easy, given that the ship was shaking and rocking about, but eventually you made it. You try to keep your mind off of what's going on around you. It proves to be difficult when you are being affected directly. Crashing and banging are everywhere. It's at that moment you realize that this is yet another part of your new life you'll have to get used to. After a little while all of the shaking stopped and it was calm and silent. However, you didn't like that there wasn't any word from you're feline friends. Part of you wanted to go out and see what was happening. At the same time though, what if you made things worse by being in the way, or what if Sadie found you and was angry that you disobeyed her?
1353322211121212112.title: The ship starts shaking violently

choices: Find the armory, you know its on the upper decks
Head deeper into the ship and find a place to hide
13533222111212121121.content:
You cautiously approached the door before pressing the button to open it. The hallway looks empty, just like always. You tentatively stepped out of your room. Still nothing. After a few more seconds, you decide to start walking down the corridors looking for any sign of your crewmates or that alien ship, but after roaming for about five minutes you found nothing.

         "Maybe they're all on the bridge," You thought. You head to the elevator and ride it up to the uppermost deck of the ship. As you walked the corridor you noticed that the door to the bridge was already open. As you got closer you started to hear voices, but there were only a couple you could recognize.

         You make your way to the doorway and peak around the corner. You nearly yelp at what you see. Your crew is being held at gunpoint while two wolves, a jackal and what you think is a husky. The husky and one of the wolves appears to be a male. But all of the other canines were definitely female. The male wolf appeared to be in charge, and holding a gun of some sort and aiming it at Rita.

         "We registered five life signs, and yet there's only four of you," The wolf snarled, "Where is the fifth member of your crew?"

         "We don't have a fifth crew memeber," Rita replied.

         "The signal we picked up was kind of weak. I might have been a glitch," The Jackal commented.          

         "Or they're hiding something," The wolf replied, "Go check the ship, every deck and every room and then report back to me which it is."

         "And if it turns out they're lying?" The female wolf asked.

         "Kill the last crewmember," The wolf replied, "But not until I see them. Bring them here and we'll do it in front of the crew."

         "You monster!" Riley snarled.

         Rita, Tammy and Sadie looked at Riley in horror while the wolf smiled before nodding to his crew, "Bring me that crewmember."

         Riley sat quietly, horrified at the idea that your chances of survival might have been put at risk because of her. The jackal, female wolf and husky turned to leave the bridge. Seeing the coming danger you turned and ran for the elevator. You made inside and turned around just in time to see the jackal making eye contact with you as the doors shut. You couldn't tell if she'd actually seen you or not. So your crew was being held at gunpoint and a kill squad was coming to get you. The question now was what floor did you need to get to?"
13533222111212121121.title: Go have a look around

choices: Try to reach the weapon to defend yourself
You can't quite move around yet
135332221112121211211.content:
You decided that the armory was your best bet. It was closer and would allow you to stand a fighting chance. You stop on the third deck and step run out into the corridor. You hear the elevator close behind you and realize that it was called up to the bridge deck. More than likely, it would return to the very floor you were on and bring some unwanted company as well.

         You sprinted through the hallways searching frantically for the armory. "It's here somewhere, I know it is" You muttered to yourself.

         You paused for a moment to catch your breath and thought about what to do when you heard the sound of rushed footsteps behind you. You picked up your pace and started running once more as you heard them closing on you. A blue lazer shot by you. You turned to find the jackal standing behind you holding some sort of communicator in one hand and a weapon in the other. "My friends are on their way, don't make this harder than it needs to be."

          You decided to ignore the crazy jackal lady and kept running. Luck seemed to be with you as you found the armory soon after that. You ran inside and locked the door. You could hear the jackal woman outside trying to blast her way in. But as luck would have it, the door was sturdier than the others. It made sense given that all of the weapons were kept there.

         "So there was another crew member," The husky noted as he and the wolf approached the jackal who was in the process of hacking the door panel.

         "What spiecies is he?" The wolf asked.

         "Does it matter?" The jackal asked as she fiddled with a hand held device that she'd wired into the door's control panel.

         You backed away from the door and began looking for a weapn to help you defend yourself. You didn't know what half of them were, and to make matters even more difficult, most of them were too big for you to weild. You settled on a weapon that looked similar to a rifle. It was one of three that hung on a rack which read 'concussion launcher'. You positioned yourself in front of the door and waited. You were sweating bullets, your trigger finger was trembling, your instincts screamed at you to be anywhere other than where you were standing. But the girls needed your help, and running away to prolong the situation wasn't going to help them. You needed to make a stand.

         The door finally groaned and slid open. The jackal woman charged in with her fangs barred and her weapon in hand. "Come with us or I'll vaporize ya, you little brat!"

         "Screw you!" You shouted as you squeezed the trigger. There was a bright orange flash. You couldn't hear or see anything. For a moment you felt weightless, and then you hurt all over. Your vision came back blurry. It slowly began to clear up as you blinked. You were laying up against the wall opposite of the door, the Jackal was sprawled out in the corridor. The weapon you'd used was laying out of your reach several feet away from you. You started to get up when the husky came in with some sort of strange pistol. He had the classic white and black husky colors and blue eyes. He wore a blue suit with armor on the kneepads and shoulder pads. He didn't have any hair and his body was lean but obviously powerful. He was a good bit shorter than Riley, but taller than Sadie and Rita.
135332221112121211211.title: Find the armory, you know its on the upper decks

choices: Riley replies, "Actually, we're theives..."
Riley replies, "Actually we're mediators for official companies"
135332222.content: What other reasons could the feline crew have for this seemingly shady business routine?
135332222.title: other

choices: Sarah
Isabelle
Laura
Katherine
Bethany
14.title: Teenage Female

choices: Before you can react, something jumps you from behind.
A loud noise and a bright light signals something hovering over you.
Whatever it is, it doesn’t show and you continue on home.
141.content:
You shiver slightly as a cool breeze weaves its way through the trees, seemingly finding any possible gap in your jacket with a mind of its own. Pulling your coat tighter around you again, you also reach up and tuck a lock of your long dark red hair back behind your ear, having escaped from the ponytail you are currently sporting. You turn your attention back to your sketchbook, currently working on a half-finished sketch of the lake before you; the water softly lapping at the edge of the bolder you are perched on. Around you rustle the remaining leaves on the trees, as the persistent wind tries to pluck the last holdout leaves of the fall season.

You try to concentrate on the drawing taking shape, but your mind keeps wandering back to worrying about your mother. It isn’t easy for your mother, being a single mother after a one night stand all those years ago. With the two jobs she regularly works, you don’t see her very often anymore, and you have yet to be able to keep a job for long to help out. Looking over at the setting sun, you know that you still have a couple hours before she gets to go home. You should be getting on your way though, so you put the finishing touches on your sketch and hop off the rock.

You happen to catch your reflection in the water, the small ripples in the water slowing enough for you to make it out. Your eyes trace over your reflected face, cute and nicely framed by your hair. Your gaze trails down across your 19 year old body, zaftig despite any amount of exercise and/or dieting, so you had just come to accept the small amount of extra weight. Your self-reflection is cut short when you feel like someone or something is watching you and hear a branch snap behind you. Whirling around, you can’t find anything, though you decide to move along anyways.

Tucking your sketchbook under your arm, you set off, never quite losing the feeling that you are being watched. Picking up your pace, you can just about see where the trees thin out ahead of you when you hear something again, and it’s closer to you this time.
141.title: Alone in the woods

choices: You come to in a bed on a ship it seems.
You wake up in what looks like a prison or dungeon.
You awaken in the forest still.
1411.content:
You hear a noise again, closer this time, and you just about realize that the sound is the quiet shushing of something moving across the leaves littering the ground before you are bowled over by something hitting you from behind. Your sketchbook escapes your grasp, bouncing away, forgotten as you are pinned to the ground with something on your back. It takes a moment for your mind to catch up and realize that one of your arms is being pulled up behind your back by who or whatever is atop you, and trying to do the same to your other arm. Your first thought is that someone is trying to rape or mug you, but that thought is mostly cleared by a quick glance over your shoulder shows a roughly human shape squatting over your prone body, seemingly wearing some type of armor, though it is hard to be sure since you can’t quite focus your eyes on it, the edges of the figure blending with the environment behind it; not exactly standard wear for someone attacking a teenage woman in a forest.

You can’t get any leverage to try and flip your attacker off, so you try the next best thing: smashing your free arm back into the face. You are rewarded with a slightly loosened grasp, as well as the oddity of a splotch of color matching your jacket slowly spreading partway across the angular and extended helmet. You can’t take advantage of the situation or see the color starting to retract as you are seeing nothing but stars, blinded from the sharp lance of pain radiating up and down your arm from cracking your not-so-funny bone on a hard and relatively unmoving object. You manage to recover enough, certainly faster than your attacker, and twist your other arm free, shoving out from underneath and bolting off. Darting between the trees, you don’t even pay much attention to where you are going, just wanting to put as much distance between you and whoever that was. Your breathing comes fast and ragged and you can hear your heartbeat pounding in your ears as you run as fast as you can, avoiding slipping in the damp leaf litter.

A quick backwards glance to see if they are still pursuing confirms that they are, and quickly gaining. Just as you turn to look where you are running, you crash into something hard and unyielding. Slumped on the ground, you hold your head, trying to will the stars away again. As your vision clears, you wonder if you had blindly ran into a tree or something, but find that you had run into something far worse. Towering over you is another armored figure, roughly humanoid again but even larger, standing about ten feet tall and around three quarters as wide with an elongated helmet perched atop. This one’s armor doesn’t have that warping effect at the edges, metallic plates easily visible and shifting as it bends forward over you, a huge hand reaching down. Scrambling backwards to get away, you instead bump right into the legs of the first one. The big one takes a long step towards you and easily picks you up by your collar in a single hand, holding you in the air with your feet dangling above the ground. Hammering on the arm does little to the giant, only serving to injure yourself some more. The smaller one reaches up and grabs the back of your head, forcing it to the side and holding it as steady as it can with your thrashing. Striking out with your legs does just as well, but you continue to try anything as you see a pistol shaped device in the other hand of the one behind you. Your panicked flailing increases but can’t prevent the thing from being jammed into the side of your neck. A sharp hiss issues from it, and a warmth rapidly spreads around your body from that point, darkness quickly enveloping your mind, your struggles ceasing.
1411.title: Not so alone after all

choices: You awaken again, this time in a drastically different room.
You come around still in the room from before, and you aren’t alone.
You are being carried around when you wake up now.
14111.content:
Consciousness returns to you slowly, your mind foggy and hazy. Your bed feels odd and lumpy for some reason, but you don’t feel like moving or trying to figure out the issue, content to remain in this limbo stage and hopeful to get back to sleep. Unfortunately, the last lingering vestiges of sleep fade away, and this allows the memories of the dream or whatever it was to drift back to your conscious brain. Remembering that unpleasant event, you sit up straight, and then immediately lay back down, a cacophony of pain and aches flooding back and crashing over you, overwhelming your senses. Your head spins as does the out-of-focus view of the world around you, and you bite your lip to avoid crying out from the pain. Any thought of your attack just being a nightmare is banished as the combination of injuries all demand your limited attention.

As you lay there, your eyes screwed shut and tearing up; you become aware of a steady vibration coming up through the bed, as well as an almost imperceptible swaying motion. As the pain starts to ebb, you remember back when your mother took you on ferry trips across a local bay and the similar sensations you got then. Did whoever or whatever that grabbed you from the forest take you a boat of some sort? Opening your eyes slowly and carefully looking around, you see a small window set in the wall at the head of the bed, stars easily visible in the night sky outside; how long had you been out? Maybe if you looked outside you could get a clue to where you are and how to get away.

Even turning over is a chore, your arms battered and with bruises starting to appear when you were trying to free yourself from the larger attacker. You finally manage it turning over though, standing being the next challenge, and a nearly insurmountable, your legs refusing to take your weight. You eventually settle on an undignified slump against the wall, before pulling yourself to lean against the frame bordering the window. Outside, the stars are vibrant and bright, far brighter than you have ever seen before, even away from the light dome in the cities. There is also no sign of any land in sight, the light sky stretching as far as you can see from your limited field of view. The ship tips slightly again and you get a view that doesn’t quite make sense till your mind makes the proper connection: you aren’t on a boat in the middle of the water at night; you are on a ship in space above the Earth. A sense of panic causes you to want to run, but instead you just tumble to the ground with another bump among all the rest.

Spying what appears to be a door across the room, you make your way there, slowly though, crawling and dragging yourself using your forearms. As you move past the bed, you see part of the reason why it felt so odd, consisting of just a thin pad placed in an alcove in the wall. Turning your attention back to the door, you hoist yourself up against the wall next to the door, and realize something rather pivotal: there isn’t a knob, button, level, latch, or anything resembling a way to open the door, just a slightly recessed section of the door that doesn’t do anything in response to your touch. There isn’t enough of a lip to get a grip, and even trying to pull on the edge of the door only results in nearly pulling a fingernail out. A few halfhearted thumps on the door and a hoarse shout provide just as much help, only aggravating your aches and pains. Slipping down the wall to the floor, you pull your knees up and hook your arms around them, despite the flaring ache that causes, burying your head in your hands.

A few moments later, you perk up as you hear footsteps coming closer, before you try to move away from the door, remembering the two that apparently abducted you. With nowhere to hide though, you are easily visible as the door opens, revealing the smaller attacker. That odd warping effect isn’t in place now, and you can get a better view, revealing armor plates attached to a flexible layer underneath. The helmet is elongated and there is a semi-transparent visor across the top and partway down the sides of the helmet. Behind the visor, you can the rough shape of a face but one that is distinctly non-human, eyes partially visible, narrowing as their owner looks at you. Before you can react, the armored figure leaps at you, and in a flash that pistol device from before is pressed into your neck, the shadow of unconsciousness crashing back over you and dragging you deep into oblivion again.
14111.title: Going on a trip

choices: She is a dragoness.
He is a wolf.
Your host is something else.
141111.content:
Conciseness returns to you once again, and after a short time, you remember all that has been happening to you. You try to lay as still as possible as you expect your body to start feeling the effects from your injuries yet again. No pain comes though, and trying to move to move your limbs slowly, you only find a hint of stiffness in your joints. The air feels warm and humid, but only somewhat uncomfortably so. Slowly opening your eyes, you find yourself in a room nearly as different from the first as could be: while the first was Spartan and definably favored function over form, the current room is much more lavish with what appears to be pieces of art scattered about. The bed you are laying on is much more impressive as well, rather than just a thin padded mat shoved in a wall alcove, this one is closer to your standard definition of a bed, spreading across many square feet, and covered in shimmering sheets that almost look like silk, but feeling like nothing you have ever touched before, so light and airy that it was like you weren’t touching anything at all.

Shifting around to the edge of the bed, you make another discovery: the wall across the room from the end of the bed is one huge unbroken and curving window allowing a view of space beyond. Stepping up to the window cautiously, you are treated to a wondrous sight: Jupiter and its moons drifting slowly to one side as the ship you are on travels out of the solar system. The window looks very thin, certainly thinner than you would think a spaceship would have – though considering that you seem to be dealing with aliens, it isn’t all hard to grasp – and grants you an incredible view, almost looking like you could reach out and touch the stellar bodies passing by. As the icy surface of Europa slips past, you think to yourself that you might be the first human to ever travel out here and see these things with your naked eye. Though if some of the alien conspiracy theorists are to be believed, some people might have beaten you out here, and they don’t seem so crazy anymore.

As the ship continues its journey, the sunward side of Jupiter is replaced with a view of the dark side, flashes of lightning just visible within the cloud layers of the giant world. Turning away from the fleeting lightshow, you turn your attention back to your current situation. You spy several doors around the room as well, but these turn out to be similar to the one from before, with no obvious means of opening them, just that slightly recessed panel that doesn’t respond to your touch. Finding no release there, you instead decide to check out some of the pieces of art, if only keep yourself busy. You can recognize some of them as maybe paintings or sculptures, but others escape your understanding, perhaps too alien for you to grasp. Feeling a bit too warm now, you pull off your coat, draping it over an arm. Before you can inspect any one piece in any great detail, one of the doors quietly whooshes open. You jump a bit in surprise, before settling down. Standing just on the threshold is an alien, you are almost sure of it, though it isn’t a little gray or green man, it looks like a humanoid fox, two legs, two arms, standing upright, fur, tail, the whole shebang. As you look closer, you realize that it might be a vixen, rather than a tod, if the somewhat prominent breasts correspond to her species the same way as it does in humans.

Stepping just inside the door, it quietly shuts behind her, seemingly without a touch or command given. She stands there, quietly waiting on you. As the initial shock wears off, you realize that this vixen might be the smaller of your two abductors, her stance and basic shape and height are the same, and her loose fighting uniform-like clothing has nearly identical marks as the armor worn by that one as well. What fur you can see is bright red, almost unnaturally so, but with smaller patches of white on her muzzle, hands, and tip of her tail. After a bit of this, she seems to be getting a bit impatient, singling this with a sharp huff and snap of her jaws. Deciding it might be best to not anger her any further – she could just dump you out an airlock or something after all – you move closer, not quite sure what she wants from you. This seems to be the right move though, as she spins on her heel and touches that recessed panel on the door, it responds to her touch, opening the door with the same almost complete lack of noise. Checking to make sure you are behind her, she steps out of the door, waits for you to step out, and then sets off down a hallway outside. While walking with your “guide”, you come across several other windows, smaller than the huge wraparound one from before, but granting you other views as these seemed to be on the side of the ship, rather than facing forwards. The shock is still a bit much for you, only numbly following the vixen ahead to wherever she is taking you. As you walked along, you spared a brief thought about the oddity that what almost certainly was alien looked like an awful lot like an anthropomorphic fox.

After walking for a while, the fox leads you to another room, seemingly overlooking the rear of the ship. Another huge wraparound window dominates the far wall, affording you a view back towards Jupiter. You also see a slight glow below the curve of the rear of the ship, perhaps that’s the engines or thrusters or whatever is propelling the craft. You then turn your attention back to the room and see what is most likely your “host”.
141111.title: Upgraded accommodations

choices: She leads you to the bridge of the ship.
She takes you to a dining room.
She guides you to the medical bay.
1411111.content:
She – again basing it on the assumption the feminine shape applied to them just as well as humans – is curled up on a curving sofa facing the rear window, a large book in her hands. As you cast a quick glance around, you realize that the room seems to be a combination sitting room and library: a number of seats curling around facing the rear window and each other, and a few large bookcases across the back wall along with the door you and the vixen entered through as well as another one. A snap draws your attention back to the woman sitting on the sofa and you see that she closed the book she was reading. She stands up, revealing just how tall she is, you guesstimate about a foot shorter than the big thing that grabbed you however long ago. She is also big in width with soft looking onyx scales wrapped around an even softer looking body. A double chin sags from under her muzzle and meaty jowls encroach on her neck; flabby arms frame large fleshy breasts that rest atop a fat stomach that flows across her rotund thighs; her thighs touch along most of their length from what you can see, and press against the top of her calves. Her body is packed into a tight shimmering dress that somewhat resembles the sheets you saw on the bed before, and is topped off with thick lustrous waves of blood-red hair that spill down over her back and shoulders. She brushes a platinum blonde forelock aside, presumably to get a better look at you as you are at her.

You try to keep your eyes averted, but can’t help yourself. Something you never told your mother, but you were reasonably sure that you were lesbian. About a year ago, things had heated up between you and one of your longtime friends, a curvy Brazilian that was born and raised in the US. The initial heat cooled quickly though and you never quite could figure out why, but at least you hadn’t lost Isabela’s friendship, even if things were a bit awkward for a while between the two of you. Now though, there is something enthralling about the dragoness before you, the way she looks and the way she moves, that is bringing up some of the feelings from back then, but a bit stronger this time you think.

Another sharp huff comes from the vixen that led you from the bedroom; irritated that you were obviously staring maybe? In any case, you try to slow your hammering heart and keep your eyes focused past the dragoness instead. Your eyes snap back though when you hear the most surprising thing: she speaks perfect English.

“She doesn’t talk much, does she?” she says, luminous green eyes flicking to the vixen standing just in front of you.

The shocks just keep coming as the vixen responds much the same, “No, ma’am. She hasn’t said a word the whole time. She does seem to be a bit more interested in you than me though,” casting a sidelong glance at you.

“Hmm…are we sure the translation nanites are functioning properly, or did something go wrong with the healing protocol?” the dragoness asks, as she walks up closer to you, a finger idly rubbing that soft looking chin. “Can you understand me? Can you speak?” she asks of you now, speaking slowly and enunciating.

Your mouth is dry – partially from your jaw hanging open in shock – but you try to speak, “Yes, I can understand you, and yes, I can speak.”

The dragoness jumps a bit, and then says “Oh, splendid, I was starting to get concerned,” clapping her hands once, and your eye follows the ripples that results from that quick motion.

“You…” you try to steady your whirling mind and your rapid breathing, “You’re aliens, right; you two and that bigger one that grabbed me?”

The dragoness nods her head, before speaking to the vixen, “You may return to your duties, Nata.”

The vixen – guard or soldier maybe, you think – hesitates a few moments before giving what you think might a salute of some sort, and then spinning on her heel and marching back out the door, which shuts behind her.

The dragoness moves back towards the sofa, settling her bulk down before speaking to you again, “You may as well sit down too, this might take a bit.”

You gingerly lower yourself down on the far end of the seat, your mind still whirling with what you are experiencing.

The dragoness takes another long look over you before speaking again, “Yes, you are correct, to you and other Earthlings, we are aliens and we come from a star system quite some distant from your own, or distant according to your species’ limited space faring abilities. My name is Shira Drakinal, and I deeply apologize for the abruptness of bringing you here, but it was discovered that time may have been quite a factor.”

“What do you mean?”

“Tell me, please, have you been experiencing random bursts of chest pain occasionally, along with a flutter in your heartbeat, and shortness of breath?”

“Yes…sometimes. My doctor checked me out, but couldn’t find anything majorly wrong. How do you know that and why?” you say with fear starting to creep up on you.

With a heavy sigh, Shira then muttered to herself “We may have been just in time.” She then looked back up at you, “Even our most basic scanners are more advanced than anything you have on your planet. We…I have been keeping an eye on you,” doing little to diminish that growing fear in you, “and our scans revealed that you have a congenital genetic defect. It is something that is unlikely to be found on your world for a number of decades at best, but far too late for you I am afraid. Rather than letting this happen, I made the decision to have you brought here, our medical technology can also fix this problem given enough time.”

“So you kidnapped me…to save my life?”

“That…is an oversimplification…, but not an inaccurate one,” she said slowly.

“Why are you taking me away from my home, couldn’t you have just healed me and dropped me off again?” your fear starting to turn into anger.

She didn’t seem to mind your outburst at all, “As I said, it will take time to correct this error. Your species is somewhat unfamiliar to our technology; doing too much at one time might prove just as disastrous as doing nothing at all. As for why we are leaving, I have to return to my territory, I’m a kraznak and I have been away for longer than expected.”

“Wait, what was that, kraznak?” trying your best to imitate whatever she said.

Shira looks up at you in surprise, “Hmm…the translation software must not be able to find a close enough match. I think something that you might know would be noble, did that translate correctly?”

You nod your head, and then ask, “Translation? Is that how you are speaking English, how?”

She lets out a little laugh, “Oh, I’m not speaking English, that’s just what a little collection of injected nanites is making it seem like.”

As you watch now, you see that her mouth isn’t moving in time with what you are hearing, and if you really strain, you can pick up an identical sounding voice behind the English that is speaking something that is distinctly not English.

“Likewise, I am hearing a translation of you sounding like you are speaking my language, Ikrodian. In time, the nanites may even let you speak and understand Ikrodian as if you had always known the language, without doing a translation overlay.”

Shaking your head and tossing aside for now the idea that they had injected you with something, you decide to go back to a previous frightening point, “Why have you ‘been keeping an eye on me’?”

Shira actually blushed, her cheek scales turning somewhat reddish, before embarrassedly admitting, “While examining your world, I found you out drawing one afternoon. I rather liked the look of your art, and started keeping an eye out to see what else you might draw.” She seems to consider something for a few moments before quietly saying, “I could have kept you unconscious for the whole time that you were being healed, but I thought you might enjoy being able to see things no other humans have before. But if you prefer, I can have you put back in stasis, and all of this will be like a dream.”

You start to respond that yes, you would, but then reconsider. How often would you get the chance to see the cosmos first hand and encounter real life aliens? You then shake your head, to which Shira gives a slight grin, just enough to curl the edge of her mouth.

“Well, come along now, we had best be off now,” she says, rising to her feet, your eyes instantly drawn to the quivering that passes through her body as she does so.

“Where are we going?” you ask, trying to hide the blush that is coloring your cheeks and neck.
1411111.title: Dragoness in charge

choices: The jump goes according to plan.
Before the jump, an urgent message arrives.
Another ship appears before you go anywhere.
14111111.content:
“We’re going on a little tour first, and then I have to head to the bridge, so come along,” Shira says as she heads for the door.

She pauses momentarily to check that you are following before opening the door and heading out. As you take off, you forget about your jacket, leaving it behind on the sofa. Out in the passage, you can scarcely keep your eyes off of Shira’s backside, though it doesn’t help that there aren’t many other things for you to look at. Those wings peeking out from her long waves of hair, that muscular tail flexing and shifting, but especially the rolling mounds of her butt rhythmically moving up and down, you just can’t keep your eyes off them. Shira either doesn’t notice or doesn’t care if she does notice as she walks along. She starts pointing out some things as she goes; down that staircase is the engineering section, through that door is the medical bay, there’s a hanger bay on the lower level of the ship, and so on till you reach the bridge.

“We can go on a bit more involved tour after I’m finished here, if that would be alright?” she asks, looking back over her shoulder.

You nod your head and considering that no one stops you, follow her onto the bridge. The room looks much like some of those you have seen on a number of science fiction programs: a number of computer stations scattered around with anthros of a number of species occupying some of them, holographic displays, and another stunning view of space out the front window. Shira made straight for the station at the front, the pilot’s station from the looks of things.

“We still on schedule, Koval?” she asks.

“Of course, my lady, we should actually be able to jump a bit earlier than initially planned,” the raccoon says with obvious respect to Shira.

“Excellent, keep up the good work,” she responds, giving him a pat on the shoulder, to which he nods.

She makes a circuit of the bridge, checking in with each person, and giving praise or encouragement as needed. You instead linger towards the back, not wanting to get in the way of anything, as well as just trying to watch the goings on. After Shira finishes talking with the last, she motions towards you as she makes her way to a chair centered in the back of the room; raised a step above the rest of the room, the chair is also somewhat more ornate than the completely functional chairs of the rest of the bridge staff. She settles down in what must be her chair, affording her a view of the whole bridge, and you step up beside her.

After another few moments of listening to the muted conversations and noises from the bridge, you work up enough nerve to speak up, “Before, you mentioned ‘my territory’, what did you mean by that?”

“Hmm? Oh, I meant exactly that,” she touches a control on the arm of her chair, and a glowing holographic display appears in the air before her. “We are here, your home system,” motioning to what is obviously a depiction of the solar system containing Earth and so on, as well as a little icon heading out past Jupiter which must be the ship. “My people have spread across a number of star systems,” as she hits several more controls and the view zooms out and moves rapidly to show a portion of the galaxy with a collection of solar systems enclosed in a red colored field. “We Ikrodens started out much like yours, on a single world in a system much like yours,” pointing at one specific star near the center of the region, “but have spread to many others across a large section of space. I oversee this portion here,” with a few more presses, a blue field encloses a few stars at one edge of the Ikroden territory. “Most of the tasks are handled by administrations that manage the mining and production factories, make sure that resources are distributed correctly, and handle disputes, that sort of thing. I do have to step in sometimes when a situation might affect the whole region, or even the entire Ikroden territory.”

“Ikroden, you are the anthropomorphic dragons?” after seeing a number of different species, you wonder.

“Oh, no, Ikroden refers to all of us, and yes, we do look like the furries and scalies of your world’s fictions. All of the races of the Ikroden look much like anthropomorphic animal species of your world, but we are all one people from one species despite the outward differences. The differences between the races of the Ikroden don’t matter so much; two beings that resemble Earth species that might not be a match on your world can freely interact and even produce children, though most children that result from a mixed mating tend to have only traits from their mother rather than mixing traits from both parents.” She then looks and speaks a bit louder towards a falcon seated to one side on the bridge, “Polk, your father was a bull, correct?”

“Yes, ma’am,” Polk responds.

“And how are you parents doing,” Shira then asks.

“Very good, ma’am, I just received a message from home while we were in orbit. My sister aced her final exams, in case you were wondering too.”

“That is good to hear,” she says, and he nods before returning his attention to the display before him. She then turns those lovely green eyes back your way, “Any other questions you want answered?”

You shake your head, “Nothing right now.”

She bows her head slightly, before switching something on the armrest again, so that the image of the galaxy vanishes and is replaced with several floating pages with scrolling text on them. This does spark something else that you want to know about.

“If I may, why do you have those books if you have holograms instead?”

She looks up at you, a little color in her cheeks again and what you assume to be an abashed expression, “Don’t laugh, but I like the feel of the paper in her hands, and the smell you get from old books. These holograms are nice, but they just can’t beat something like that sometimes.”

“Why would I laugh, I’m actually much the same.”

She doesn’t say anything at that, but she does make a little hum at the back of her throat. After a bit, you pace around at the back of the room, looking over some of the screens at the unoccupied stations, but don’t have a hope of understanding. A short time later, Koval speaks up.

“Ma’am, we’re approaching the edge of the system, we’ll be ready to jump within a few minutes.”

“Hmm…we are a bit ahead of schedule, aren’t we?” Shira says looking up from one of the screens in front of her, to which the raccoon nods. Then she looks over at you, “You might want to take a seat and strap in,” pressing a button on her chair and then motioning towards a seat that silently folds out of the floor beside her own, “A jump can be unpleasant for those unaccustomed to them.”

As you take the seat – realizing that the seat was obviously made to handle someone much larger than yourself – and automatically get strapped down, you ask, “A jump? Some faster-than-light travel, I’m guessing?”

Shira gives a smile, her numerous sharp teeth glinting, “Very good, you are correct. I don’t know all the details myself; it’s all extremely complex and goes way over my head, but the Ikroden couldn’t have spread as far as we could have without that marvelous drive system.”

“Why did we have to come out to the edge of the system? Couldn’t you have just jumped from where we were, near Earth?”

Rather than answering, she looks over at another person on the bridge, “Sisha, perhaps you would like to field those questions?”

The somewhat short and stocky polar bear turns slightly, “Of course, ma’am.” Then she addresses you, “Large gravity wells can interfere with the FTL calculations and process, so moving away from a large gravity source – such as a star – makes things far simpler and easier. In addition, moving to FTL travel produces a noticeable energy signature, moving far enough away from an underdeveloped world means that there is much less likely to any undue exposure. Since we are this far out, the energy might be detected by your world as a cosmic blip rather than a massive burst of exotic energies.”

“Thank you, Sisha,” first to Sisha, then you, “That answer your question?”

“Good enough.”

Shira nods again, turning her attention back to the screens floating in front of her. At the front of the bridge, Koval hits some buttons next to him before speaking, his voice also coming out of speakers it sounds like.

“All hands, prepare for jump.”

He then starts counting down, his hands flying over his panel doing whatever it is he is doing.
14111111.title: Some more learning

choices: You wake up by yourself again.
Someone is at the door, waking you up.
You come to in the medical lab.
141111111.content:
“Jump commencing,” Koval announces at the end of the countdown.

You become aware of a rising whine, but it’s less something you hear, and more something you feel, it actually feels like it’s vibrating the molars in the back of your mouth. The sensation only gets worse as the moments pass; it gets so bad that you almost miss how the empty space in front of the ship is warping and stretching. Suddenly with a lurch, the ship leaps forwards into the strange effect and down a tunnel made of spiraling twisting splashes of colors. You can’t really pay attention to that though, it feels like your head is being turned inside out, and you are feeling extremely nauseous. Through the fog that is wrapping around your head, you can almost make out Shira saying something, not enough to understand it but she sounds concerned you think, but soon enough it doesn’t matter as the fog completely envelopes your mind and you pass out.

You snap awake, and feel somewhat queasy, but not terribly so. You are back in the opulent bedroom you woke up in before you met Shira.

Almost as if on cue, you hear Shira’s voice, now a sultry purr, “Ah, good, you’re awake.”

She is standing in the doorway, her arms braced on either side and her eyes are half lidded as she stares at you. You are about to ask about what happened, but your voice catches in your throat as she sashays into the room, her dress dropping to the ground as she does so, leaving her soft scaly body completely bare. Your heartbeat pounds in your chest as your eyes whip this way and that, taking in every curvy pound on display before you. Before you can do anything else, she pounces on you, so much warm soft flesh oozing across your body, you can barely restrain yourself. You clear your throat and try to speak again, but she presses two fingers to your mouth, small claws teasing your lips.

“Shush,” she barely breathes, “Let’s get rid of these naughty distractions first.”

She leans back, straddling your legs and rising above you, the soft lighting above her granting you a silhouette of the dragoness and her myriad curves as well as casting you in her shadow. She reaches down and without any fanfare, tugs off your sweatshirt and tosses it aside, which is quickly joined by your shirt fluttering in the air. Her hands trace across your body, leaving a trail of goose bumps in their wake, while you can see the glint of her teeth in the shadows of her mouth. She leans down again, your soft flesh yielding to her much softer flesh and bringing a moan to your lips.

“You don’t know how long I’ve been wanting to do this,” she whispers in your ear, her breath tickling as she does so.

Her hair falls down in waves around you like a curtain, then lightning quick she pounces again, this time pressing her muzzle to your mouth. At first, you’re in a bit of shock, but with a little time, Shira gets you in the swing of things. Her long narrower tongue darts into your mouth, wrapping about yours several times and giving a little squeeze, giving you a little thrill and making you arch your back. She reaches down and you feel her undo your pants, and tug them off, the discarded article soon joining the rest of the clothing on the floor. The kiss continues on for a time, longer than you were expecting, but you have to break it when you feel out of breath. Oddly, your breath doesn’t return yet, it is still hard for you to breath and it’s actually getting harder. That’s when you see it: Shira is getting bigger, fatter, heavier, and you can actually see her body swelling as you watch.

She must see the surprise on your face, because she lets out a little laugh, then says, “What, are you surprised that all that feeding you’ve been doing is having an effect on me? But let’s hurry things up a bit, more food is coming and I’m simply ravenous,” her teeth gleaming in the light, but the look on her face suggests she’s hungry for something more than just food.

Your breathing is getting bad enough that it’s hard to speak, to question what she meant, but you don’t want it to stop. The feeling of her weight crushing you into the bed, the heat and lovely smell you are getting off of her, the feeling of all of this soft flesh pouring over you, every bit is simply divine. Her expanding hasn’t stopped or slowed, if anything it’s sped up; you can see her body slowly rising further and further over you as her stomach expands pressing higher overtop of you. Her breasts are similarly affected, spreading higher and higher, pooling around your neck and encroaching on your face. Oh, to be drowned in dragoness flesh, that isn’t something you haven’t considered before, but you can’t move to stop it, even if you wanted to. The bed creaks and groans and you moan as the pressure continues to mount. Shira just continues to smile, sometimes jostling her body, sending waves that you can feel with your whole body. She flicks her tongue out, the forked tip tickling your nose, and somewhat distracting you from a different motion. Soon enough, you feel it though: her long thick tail wiggling and wriggling, snaking up between your legs. She pauses as her tail reaches her target, the tip just tickling your slit. You shift your hips as much as you can against the weight pressing down you, wanting her to continue. She smiles that lovely smile again, before leaning down to nip at your neck. You can feel her tail tense up and prepare yourself…then you wake up.

Like a hammer blow, you bolt awake, your chest heaving and your body soaked with sweat. As you take stock, you realize that your hand is tucked in the waist of your pants, fingers just teasing like Shira’s tail…in the dream, you realize. You groan as you tug your hand free, wiping your fingers on your pants after you do so. Your head still feels odd and your stomach is a bit off kilter, but it doesn’t feel like you’re going to throw up now. You’re in a different bedroom, a bit less ornate than what must be Shira’s but several grades above the Spartan room you woke up in the first place. Outside a small window, you can see the colored tunnel shooting past. The light proves oddly soothing and you feel your eyelids drooping no matter how hard you try. Soon you are falling asleep, rather than just going unconscious, but a little fluttering thought moves to the front: you hope to have another dream like that one.
141111111.title: Interstellar travel doesn’t agree with everyone

choices: …the medical lab, or so it appears.
…the bridge, keeping an eye on docking.
…her room, conversing with someone else.
1411111111.content:
Consciousness returns to you much easier this time, and you feel better as you awake. That last though comes back around and after a bit, you realize that you didn’t have any further dreams, not even like that one. Sitting up on the edge of the bed, you stretch your arms way up, feeling your back pop in several places as you do so. As you noticed the first time around, the room you find yourself in is rather luxurious, but somewhat less so than the first room you woke up in. You notice that outside the window, the tunnel of light from the FTL travel is gone; it is instead replaced with star speckled space again. Getting up and walking over to the window, you realize that the ship is now orbiting a planet, an actual alien world from the looks of things. A lush green world spins beneath your view with far less visible water than you might expect. Bands of reddish clouds dot the upper atmosphere, though a larger purplish mass of clouds seems to be letting loose with rain and lightning. One of the more telling parts that you aren’t around Earth is the fact that you can see two distinct moons circling this world, in addition to several large space stations—one of which you seem to be heading towards. You briefly wonder if you are more of a prisoner than anyone is letting on, especially with how often you seem to be confined to rooms by yourself; this is quite a posh jail cell though.

You wander around a bit, before a whim sends you towards the door. Still no sign of any means of opening the door except for that recessed spot again. On another whim, you touch that spot and are surprised when the door opens. There’s no sign of anyone outside the door, so that helps dispel some of the thought that you are a prisoner; a prisoner would likely be locked in the room and have a guard stationed if the door wasn’t locked…right? You waver for a moment before stepping out of the room; you don’t feel like just waiting around to be collected again. Perhaps you should have though, because within a few minutes you find yourself lost in the passageways of the ship; some of the doors still won’t respond to your touch. The ship doesn’t seem to be city sized or anything, but it is still large enough that you haven’t seen anyone nor have you found anything recognizable. You are about to try calling out to see if anyone would hear you when you hear someone grunting and exclaiming from up ahead.

Following the noises towards their source – since you don’t seem to have many other options – you come to a large room that seems to be set up like a training room or dojo or whatever. The sole occupant seems to be doing hand to hand combat against floating holographic targets. He is a gigantic wolf, silver and black fur covering huge mounds of muscles that are barely concealed under his flexing hide. He is bare from the waist up – his thick fur shining from sweat - and his teeth are bared as he punches, kicks, elbows, head butts, and whatever else he can do as he tears into the targets. Too focused on his task, he doesn’t notice you. Looking around, you spot sections of armor stacked on a bench close to you, armor that you recognize as that worn by the giant that grabbed you however long ago on Earth. Looking back at the wolf, it clicks: this very well may be the massive figure that hefted you one handed while Nata, the vixen, drugged you.

As the last of the targets shatters under one of his blows, he seems to drop into something almost meditative: his posture relaxed, his eyes shut, and his breathing already slowing. After a few moments of that, he fur on the back of his neck stands up a bit and he cracks one eyelid open, fixing the golden orb squarely on you.

“I thought I smelled you here,” he says, his voice is a deep rumble mixed with boulders grinding together.

You get a little annoyed, “Sorry, I haven’t exactly been able to clean up since you guys grabbed me—whenever you did that.”

“I wasn’t insulting you, or at least I didn’t mean to, I merely meant that you are different and have a different scent, that is all,” the wolf says, holding his hands up.

“Oh,” you respond, a little bit of color flushing your cheeks.

“But where are my manners in any case; T’hol, at your service,” he says, performing that salute or whatever that you saw Nata the vixen perform. “Was there something you needed?”

“No,” you answer, shaking your head, before you turn the shake into a nod. “Actually yes, I got a little lost…all right, very lost. I was looking for Shira, and I had no idea where I was going, and ended up here.”

T’hol gives a throaty little rumble, and it takes you a few moments to realize that he is chuckling.

He then says, “Do not be concerned, that happened to me before, as well as Nata when we first came on board. I can take you to her if you wish.”

You think about it for a bit before giving a tiny nod. The wolf bows his head before motioning for you to follow him back out into the hallway. He sets a quick pace, his long legs granting him an even longer stride, but you do your best to keep up. As you follow, you pick up a musky sent wafting off of him, and while it doesn’t stir anything in you, you don’t find it unpleasant either. T’hol says that you will be able to clean yourself and even get a change of clothes shortly, if you so desire. You mumble that might be nice. He nods his head before turning his full focus back on where he is walking. You don’t recognize anything yet, but he certainly seems to know where he is going. Soon enough, he leads you to Shira in…
1411111111.title: Meeting someone new

choices: She takes you down to the planet below.
She leads you onto the station.
She goes with you to her room on the ship.
14111111111.content:
T’hol leads you to a room that appears to be in the center of the ship, though it is hard for you to be sure. The room seems to be a medical room, gleaming metal, complex machines, bed-like structures, and a vaguely familiar antiseptic smell that triggers memories of the hospital. The wolf looks around momentarily before marching off to a side door, beyond which lies what is mostly recognizable as an office. Following him in, you hear two people speaking; one is Shira, and the other sounds like another woman. Your thought is soon proved correct as you step into the office.

“Mistress, Sarah, the human was looking for you, so I brought her to you,” T’hol says, bowing his head so that his chin is shoved to his chest.

“Ah, we were just talking about you, Sarah, were your ears burning?” Shira says with a bit of a laugh, then looking towards T’hol, “You can return to your training, T’hol.”

He bows his head again and salutes her before marching off, leaving you with the two women. The other woman is tall with a voluptuous figure that inspires a bit of envy in you. She is also very distinctly a cow with short white fur splotched with black patches, from what you can see of it. Clad in a form fitting body suit that reveals every nuance of her figure, your eyes are drawn first to her huge gravity defying breasts—each bigger than her head. You can also see her wide shapely hips below the edge of the desk she is sitting behind, and a plush belly that is almost lost in the shadows of her bust. Her thick luminous black waves of hair are mostly tied into a braid that extends down to where her tail flicks around behind her. You again guesstimate her height to be not quite as tall as Shira and certainly not as tall as T’hol, but still more than tall enough to stand over you were she standing. She casually pushes the slender eyeglasses perched atop her nose a little higher, and you get a better view of her sky blue eyes staring right back at you. With a gulp, you realize that you are staring at her just like you did Shira.

“Sarah, may I introduce my Chief Medical Officer, Lyra,” Shira says, waving her hand towards the other woman, as if to dispel some of the awkwardness lingering in the air.

“Pleased to meet you,” you say, holding your hand out, and you can feel a blush heating your cheeks.

“We’ve actually already met,” Lyra says, standing up and taking your hand, and then noting the look on your face, “you were unconscious at the time though. It was shortly after you were brought on board for your first treatment. Speaking of, are you feeling better since then?”

“Yes, quite, except for the nausea and everything during the jump,” you respond.

“Yes, I heard about that, and I apologize about that, I wasn’t expecting it to have such an adverse effect on you,” Lyra says coming around to perch on the side of the desk near you. Shira chimes in with her own apology too, before Lyra speaks again, “I should be able to adjust the next treatment to help deal with that situation.”

“‘Treatment’? You mean for that condition you detected in me?” you ask, looking between Shira and Lyra, getting nods from both. “All right, when can get started, I would rather not go through that again, and definitely don’t feel like dying yet.”

“I was actually going to have you brought here now, so we could get started. If you would please follow me,” Lyra responds, leading you back out into the main part of the lab—granting you an excellent view of her rump bobbing around in front of you while she does so. She then motions for you to lay down in one of the beds in the room, and you do so. She walks up to the wall above the bed – giving you a great view of her breasts– and brings up a holographic interface. She hits a few “buttons” on the display, and a clear shell closes around you and the bed before an arm starts slowly winding back and forth in a track on the outside of the shell.

“Since you are awake this time, I will have to tell you, remain as still as you can, it will make things proceed a bit quicker,” Lyra says, her voice seemingly coming from a speaker within your surroundings.

You nod your head in understanding. On the next pass, the arm emits a green light in a broad beam that seeps across you, leaving you more than a little itchy in its wake; you do your best to hold still though. Shira walks up on the other side of the bed, casting a casual glance down at you, and giving a little smile when you look back at her. Despite yourself, you feel drawn to both women, Shira with her extremely soft frame, and Lyra with her exaggerated curves. Should you really be feeling attracted to aliens though, even if they are aliens who happen to resemble anthros? Plus, both of them seemed like they were a bit out of your age range, though you couldn’t be sure on that count, maybe they aged differently than humans.

These thoughts and more continue to whirl through your head – as well as an almost irresistible urge to start scratching all over due to the beam – as the machine makes numerous more passes back and forth. The monotonous motion and more than a little boredom soon make you nearly nod off, till the sound of the arm stops and the beam shuts off. With a hiss, the shell opens up, letting you out of what you now realize is getting a bit stifling within.

“There you go, that’s the second treatment finished, and you shouldn’t have nearly as much issue with FTL travel now,” Lyra said, still examining the holographic display.

“So doc, any idea how many more treatments it might take?” you ask.

She seems half lost in thought, manipulating several holo displays now, but manages to murmur, “Hard to say for sure, but I would expect approximately twelve more sessions might be sufficient.”

Around twelve more times of this, not exactly what you are hoping for, but if it saves your life, you think you can put up with it.

Shira then speaks up, “Is she cleared to leave for now, Lyra? We should be about to dock.”

Stirring out of her thoughts, “Of course, ma’am, she may leave now if she wishes.”

Shira then turns to you, “Well, it’s up to you then, do you want to come with me?”

“You pause for a moment before answering, “Yes, but do you think I can get cleaned up sometime soon, and maybe get a change of clothes?”

Shira nods her head before saying, “I think that can be arranged.”
14111111111.title: Not just the nurse

choices: You are heading for a palatial home actually on one of the mountains.
Your destination is a city on the far side of the mountains.
Your target is in fact within the mountains themselves.
141111111111.content:
Shira leads you out of the medical lab and back into the increasingly familiar hallways of the ship—or at least familiar in style since you are still have minimal ability to navigate through the bowels of the vessel. Again, you can’t quite keep your eyes from the dragoness’s rolling rump, now shimmering beneath a similar but still somewhat different dress, but you are also left thinking about Lyra now no matter how much you want to avoid thinking of either of them in such a way. It doesn’t take long before the two of you enter what must be a hanger bay; its smaller than you were expecting, just enough room for the pair of smaller ships contained within to maneuver their way out of the bay door that makes up the far wall. Rather than heading for either of the shuttles, Shira instead leads you to a small locker room connected to the hanger. The dragoness then pulls out a flexible suit from one of the lockers; you soon realize that the suit seems to be a spacesuit of some sort, though much less bulky than you are used to seeing from Earth. Shira briefly holds it up to you, likely checking the size against you. Seemingly satisfied, she hands it to you before strutting behind the center bank of lockers.

“You shouldn’t need that, but I always believe in being prepared,” she calls out as she vanishes about the other side.

You nod in understanding – despite knowing that she can’t see your motion – since you believe much the same. You wonder if you are supposed to put it on or just hold onto it just in case, and start to move around the lockers to ask but freeze in place for a moment before darting back to the other side, your cheeks blazing at the brief image of Shira stripping off her dress revealing the soft flesh beneath. Shaking your head does little to dispel the lingering picture from your mind, but you still try to focus on the suit hanging in your hands. Figuring that you should be putting the suit on yourself, you next wonder if you should strip down as well, but find that this likely won’t be needed when you discover the suit should be more than large enough to fit over your clothes. Soon enough, you have slipped the suit on and find that it is even larger than you first thought, the extra material bunching up around your body, likely a sign that it was made for someone a good bit larger than yourself. You also discover that there is no sign of a helmet, whether as part of the suit or in the locker the suit came from.

Hearing Shira coming to your side of the locker, you start to ask her about this, but your voice catches in your throat when you see her step out, now clad in a similar suit; but while yours is loose and baggy, hers is skin tight, the shiny material pulled taut across her rotund frame. You try to keep your eyes away from her body, but fail completely as your gaze roams the myriad curves highlighted by the outfit. There’s little doubt that Shira hasn’t noticed your wandering eyes, especially now, and the next time your eyes make the long journey up to her face, you see signs that she has indeed noticed, but rather than annoyance or anything negative, you instead see a little twinkle of mirth in her eyes and a slight curl of a smile on her lips giving you a slightly hopeful feeling. She doesn’t say anything about this encounter, instead telling you to follow her back out into the bay.

You do so, and she heads right for the smaller of the two ships: mostly a small cargo bay with a few seats set into the walls along both sides and the cramped cockpit to the front of the rear compartment. T’hol and Nata are already seated and chatting amicably while they wait, and they both bow their heads respectfully as Shira breezes past heading straight for the cockpit. The vixen motions for you to take a seat, and you barely do so before the rear hatch whooshes closed and the shuttle rises off of the hanger floor. Through a small window in the wall behind your seat, you see your current transportation zip out of the bay door and are promptly hit with a fluttering feeling in your stomach and a lack of sensation from your seat beneath you. It takes you a few seconds before you realize that you’re weightless and not secured down, unlike the two across from you. T’hol lets loose with a little bit of a deep rumble that you can only interpret as his laughter as you scramble to take your seat again before figuring out the harness. The giant wolf unstraps and floats across the space between the two of you to assist you. You tell him thanks as he drifts back to his seat giving you a slight bob of his head. Now secured down, you spare a thought for the wonders of artificial gravity that the Ikroden obviously had; it certainly makes things easier to handle in space than everything freely floating about.

Turning your attention back to the window, you watch in awe as the green world grows steadily larger as the shuttle hurtles through the vacuum behind the atmosphere. Craning your neck and nearly pressing your nose to the “glass” you can also see the ship you came from nestled in the embrace of the station you saw before. You feel a subtle shift shortly before a slight thump that you figure might signal atmospheric entry. You continue to stare out the window as new details are slowly revealed as the ship continues to rocket towards the ground. You soon make out trees that are somewhat familiar to you, but seemingly far larger than the largest known on Earth if you understand what you are seeing correctly. You can also see rivers and lakes, but still no oceans or even seas from what you can tell. There are mountains though, large ranges that are nearly dwarfed by the trees that swallow most of their flanks except for the peaks.

You feel another shift as the shuttle banks slightly, dipping closer to the thick canopies of the trees below. You can see Shira’s hands gliding over the control surface of the shuttle in the cockpit, her eyes focused out of the front window as she continues to control the shuttle through the atmosphere. Leaning forward as far as your harness allows, you can make out that the shuttle is heading for a particular mountain range in the distance.
141111111111.title: Planet bound

choices: You think you can manage, and tell her no.
You might need some help, so she gets a servant to help you.
You might need some help, but she herself helps you.
1411111111111.content:
You soon see a glimmer that appears on the peak of one of the mountains the shuttle is heading for. As you continue to get closer, you can see more and more details until you are reasonably sure that you’re looking at a structure, and a large one at that. Eventually you are sure that you are heading for a very large building or collection of buildings built on the crest of the centermost and tallest mountain in the range. Shira’s fingers continue their motions across the controls, and in response the shuttle slows down for landing. Just before the mountain slips below the edge of the cockpit window, you see something that shocks you: the building is not built on the mountain, the bottom of the bowl-like platform it rests on is hovering quite a distance over the rocks below, yet another sign of Ikrodian technological prowess.

The shuttle settles on a landing pad built into the surface of the platform with barely a thump, and the rear hatch lowers similarly to how it raised just a short time ago. You feel a waft of damp air rushing into the shuttle, and smell something in the breeze that almost reminds you of an earthy scent with something else that you can’t quite figure out. Before Shira leaves the cockpit, she hits a few more “keys” and just like that a very subtle thrumming sensation that you barely notice vanishes; the engines of the shuttle shutting down, you assume. Shira then appears in the doorway, looking pleased with herself.

“No problems back here, right?” she asks.

“Nothing insurmountable,” Nata says, her eyes flicking in your direction, followed by T’hol’s response, “Your flying was wonderfully as usual, my lady.” You then manage to somewhat find your voice, “I just wasn’t ready for weightlessness, I wasn’t belted down when we launched.”

Shira gets a look that you interpret as embarrassed, “I’m sorry; I should have warned you about that.”

You wave it off, and she nods before leading everyone out onto the landing pad outside, T’hol’s and Nata’s armor glinting in the sunlight peaking through the clouds.
