“Welcome to Eylara,” the dragoness proclaims with more than a little pride in her voice as she casts a quick glance over her shoulder at you.

You have to admit that, the world is extremely impressive, beautiful even, and that’s not even considering that you’re standing on an alien planet circling an alien star. Before you can say anything though, an extremely diminutive owl comes dashing around the ship, his snowy feathers so fluffed out that he looks somewhat larger than he really is.

“Pardon me, my lady,” he says after skidding to a stop and bowing so low that he is momentarily bent completely in half.

“It is no problem, mitok Klyne, what is it?”

He pauses momentarily, his head spinning around nearly one hundred and eighty degrees to glance at you with saucer sized orange eyes– making you feel more than a little ridiculous still swamped in the oversized spacesuit – before spinning around to continue speaking with Shira, “The situation on Mota Prime is worse than initially expected, I thought you might want to oversee the matter yourself.”

“Of course, thank you for bring it to my attention,” Shira says while setting off towards the entrance with the little owl man following in her wake, before calling back over her shoulder, “Nata, can you see to Sarah in the meantime?”

“Of course, ma’am,” the vixen responds, then turning to the wolf still at her side, “I’ll join you as soon as I am able then, T’hol.”

The giant wolf gives a little nod and a rumble from deep in his chest before following the route taken by Shira and the other, but at a more sedate pace.

Nata has already turned back to you, “Shall we?” motioning towards the door that everyone seems to be using.

You nod and the two of you move along, but along the way you ask, “If you don’t mind me asking, what does mitok mean, the…translation didn’t trigger on that.”

She seems lost in thought for a few moments before answering, “Another way to say it would be regent; did that translate correctly?” After you nod, she continues on explaining, “He oversees the estate when Lady Shira is away, as well as overseeing most operations throughout this region of space.” You nod in understanding, and continue walking alongside Nata in silence, but she then speaks up, “If you would like, we can have someone look into the translation system when we have a chance, it wouldn’t do to miss something important, would it?”

You nod in agreement again and the two of you continue walking first through the gilded doors and then through opulent halls that leave you more than a little dazzled. Artwork abounds, though you are only partially certain that some if it is artwork as you understand it. You nearly run into the vixen when she stops in front of a door. She opens it and steps aside, ushering you inside, revealing a bedroom nearly rivaling Shira’s on the ship. She then surprises you by saying that this will be your room, though you are actually somewhat expecting it at this point. As you are still dealing with the shock that came from that revelation, she points out another door and says that the bathroom is through there, before asking if you needed any assistance in that matter.
1411111111111.title: A palace in the sky

choices: Someone is in the other room already.
You look through the closet and manage to find something.
You can’t find anything that fits you in the closet.
14111111111111.content:
You tell her no, you should be able to manage, how difficult could it be after all? Nata looks almost dubious, just for a split second before she hides it away. Nodding again, she turns on her heel before shutting the door behind her, leaving you alone in a room probably worth more than your mother’s entire home. Dismissing the little shiver traveling down your spine, you turn your attention to the bathroom door and what lies beyond. The door opens at your touch and the room behind it is more than you a imagining: beautiful fixtures that seem more like artwork than something that should be sullied with something as low as cleaning you, as well as a mosaic of jewel-like stones that make sweeping curves across the whole floor, and a huge sunken tube in the center of the room. You focus more on the alcove in the far wall, considering that it looks close enough to a shower for you. A subconscious tap on your shoulder makes you take a quick glance around before stripping out of the baggy spacesuit and your own clothes beneath, and tossing everything into piles at the base of the wall as you step inside. As soon as you are just inside the alcove, a door soundlessly slips out of the wall, sealing you in.

Looking around, you start to reconsider your decision of denying assistance, since there aren’t any knobs, handles, or even buttons. Thinking of the panels on the various doors though makes you look for a similar panel here and quickly find it. Raising your hand to nearly touch it, and watch with more than a little amazement as the featureless indent comes alive with light and color. Not that this helps you much, since you can’t read or understand any of the symbols displayed there; you again think about getting some help but decide to press on and do your best, figuring it is just a shower after all, though a small twinge in your mind hopes that it’s just a shower. Looking the panel over again and again, you find a likely possibility and touch it, and are rewarded not with a stream of water, but instead with clouds of steam shooting out of the walls hitting you from all directions as well as a steady pulsing that gives you an almost ticklish sensation.

You gasp as the wave of heat overtakes you, taking your breath away. Sweeping your arm to try to clear the obscuring cloud of steam and reveal the panel again, you frantically look for something that might be a temperature control. Poking the possibility once does lessen the heat but not enough, prompting you to hit it several times; the steam is still extremely hot but much more manageable now. You soon find a small shelf built out from the wall that has what appears to be soap and shampoo, and are soon lathering your body up as the waves of steam washes it away. The shampoo is pleasantly floral scented, and reminds you of some from Earth, but not quite. It doesn’t take long before the shampoo suds are rinsed from your hair too, but you linger in the shower, savoring the wet heat and subtle vibrations washing over your body. As you stand there, your mind wanders, and again get images of Shira flitting through your mindscape. You see the dragoness in the skintight spacesuit again, but now she is being fed huge amounts of food by your hand. In your mind’s eye, Shira bloats up at an impossible speed, swelling out against the confines of the taut material, till it starts to rip and tear, exposing more of her flesh. Your wandering mind also adds Lyra in, feeding Shira as well and causing the dragoness to expand even faster.

You shake your head vigorously just as your imagined Shira bursts out of the suit, and find yourself panting from both the heat and your building arousal. Stabbing a finger at the panel, you manage to shut everything down and open the door; the last trace of steam billowing and fading as the seal is released, leaving you feeling cleaner than you ever have before. The relative chill in the air after the heat of the shower hits you like a ton of bricks, chilling the water still clinging to your skin and already causing your teeth to chatter. You find a towel and dry off as quickly as you can, which helps to take the chill away, before tying a second towel around your body. You remember seeing a closet out in the bedroom portion of the suite and want to check if you can find anything else that might fit you before getting back into your own dirty clothes.
14111111111111.title: Cleaning up

choices: …a table set on a balcony for you and Shira.
…a huge dining room for everyone in the palace.
…a small room just off of the kitchens for some of the staff.
141111111111111.content:
You jump in shock upon entering the other room because there is something standing there, waiting for you apparently. He’s not something you have seen before, almost as tall as T’hol but far thinner; he looks to be an armadillo, but there is something simian to his face and hands as well. He’s dressed in a stylish jack and paints that again remind you of a uniform. You also notice how he is extremely careful to keep his eyes averted, but you still pull the towel around your body a bit better.

He clears his throat before saying, “Krole, at your service,” bowing so low that his dark hair falls like a curtain about his face. Rising, he continues, “Lady Shira sent word that you would most likely require a change of clothes,” and without shifting his gaze, he points to the small pile on the foot of the bed. “It is the best that could be done on such short notice, but we should be able to do better tomorrow if that will be satisfactory, ma’am.”

You are left momentarily stunned by how well everyone seems to be treating you, before recovering and saying, “Yes, that will be fine.” You start to walk over to the pile of clothes, but stop after a couple steps and turn back to him, “Eh, what about my dirty clothes, I just left them and the suit lying in there.”

“Your clothing will be sterilized and returned to you. If you wish however, we can perhaps use your own clothing as a basis for what we will provide to you?”

You nod your head again, and start to head over to them, but just before you reach them, he speaks up again, saying that he will wait outside for you till you are ready. Almost soundlessly, he leaves you alone, letting you look over the clothing provided. Both are similar to the uniforms you have seen, but less ornate and more functional, and now that you can touch them, the fabric is extremely smooth and light feeling, but completely opaque as well. The material slides effortlessly over your body, feeling cool to the touch, but keeping you warm at the same time. With that taken care of, your body seems fit to remind you that you haven’t eaten in however long and grumbles loudly, though not as much as you think it should be. When it passes, you move quickly to the door and find Krole waiting as he said.

You start to ask if you could get something to eat, but the armadillo-ape is already speaking, “Lady Shira also mentioned that you might be hungry as well. If you would like, I could take you to get something to eat.”

You nod, and he quickly turns and heads down the hallway, leading you along. He doesn’t say any more and you don’t feel like trying to speak up, just wanting to get something to eat, so the only noises that follow in your wake are the clacking of hard soles and the soft swishing of the clothing as the two of you walk along. Soon enough, your nose starts to be tickled by a collection of smells coming from ahead of you; they range from somewhat familiar to those that are totally unrecognizable to you, but together they make your stomach grumble in anticipation. Krole soon comes to another door and quickly opens it before stepping aside and letting you walk in first, revealing…
141111111111111.title: Meeting another of the staff

a sixty foot alien feline with a pescatarian diet
a passing furry crewed spaceship that beams everyone up
142.content:
All things considered, your life is good.

It probably shouldn't be, if you looked at it from the outside critically. Eighteen years and a handful of weeks ago, you (Isabelle Fuentes) were born to a unwed teenage Latina mother who had no high school degree, no family support (including your father) and no employment prospects. Yet your Mom somehow kept things together and kept you healthy and loved.

But you and your Mom would have probably just scraped by if, on your fifth birthday, your Mom got a job as a maid for the Wilkinson family.

The greater Wilkinson family owned half of Newton County, and Darlene Wilkinson was the grand dame of Newton High Society. Her youngest daughter, like you mother, was a single mother with a daughter your age named Samantha Wilkerson

Normally, considering your respective socioeconomic positions, you and Samantha wouldn't have had anything to do with each other. She was the blue eyed redheaded favorite of the most powerful woman in your part of the state, You were a five year old Mexican-American girl who...well, the kindest words directed at you by some of the bigots around you was "anchor baby."

Samantha's grandmother, though, had no problem with her granddaughter and you playing together while your mother worked

Samantha's grandmother was so impressed with your mother that she gave your mother starting capital to start her own cleaning service.

Your Mom now owns the biggest cleaning service in the tri-county area.

At age six, you and Samantha went to peewee cheerleading camp, where you met Donna Freeman and Masumi Abiko. And that was how the Sisterhood of the Traveling Pom Poms was born.

Well, that's what your collective mothers call your friendship. The name has sort of stuck, and some more rakish males will remark about how all four of you appear to have the same size "pom poms."

Okay, granted, you and your friends are all approximately the same size, same weight and are definitely and equally blessed in the "pom pom" area, but there's no reason to go into that, is there?

Anyway, you, Samantha, Donna and Masumi have been friends since you were six. All of you made the cheerleading squad in your freshman year at high school, which was unheard of. One or two freshmen might make it on the squad, but most didn't get accepted until at least their sophomore year.

Not only that, but Samantha made captain her junior year, and you were here co-Captain your senior year. And both your junior and senior year, the squad made it to Nationals, winning the whole thing in your senior year.

And now you were going your separate ways. Well, not totally separate. You and Masumi were both going to MIT., Masumi for engineering and you for art..That was almost a given, that one of you would have to go with Masumi. She might appear to be vibrant and extroverted on the green, but in person, she was painfully shy.

Donna was going to Rice, with ambitions of being a biomedical researcher, while Samantha was going to Yale to eventually get her MBA. This was due in part to the admiration she had for her grandmother, and her desire to emulate her.

You four would have the summer together, and would keep in touch all the time, but you would still be going off on different paths.

So the four of you made a promise to spend as much time together as as you could.

Which is why you were at the Wilkerson summer cabin on Senior Prom weekend.

Obviously all four of you could have had dates, Except Masumi had a panic attack any time a guy asked her out. And since "giving it up" was considered a mandatory after Prom ritual (at least in the eyes of the guys), you and Samantha weren't planning on going, Being the daughters of single mothers, both of you were all for taking it slow.

Donna had been dating someone regularly for the last six months, and had confided to the three of you that she planned to "give it up," but her boyfriend had started being a real ass about the whole thing, and so she had cut him loose.

Which is why the four of you were sitting around a firepit on a very secluded lake cabin under a star filled sky.

"So do you think we should get a haircut?" Donna said, lifting a strand of her hair to her eye. Donna's ethnic background was a mix of East African and the Indian subcontinent, with a splash of Polynesian mixed in.

"Maybe just the ends trimmed," you suggest, which gets a general nod from everyone around the fire. You've all kept your hair to just past the middle of your back for as long as you've known each other and, other than a little maintenance, had been fine with that for all that time.

Masumi was about to make another S'more when she stopped. "I keep on hearing about the Freshman Fifteen," she began.

Samantha pulled up her shirt to reveal a flat stomach. She patted it, adding, "We're good right now. We'll just have to keep an eye on it."

The small talk around the firepit continued until it is interrupted by
142.title: Sisterhood of the Traveling Pom Poms

1421.content:
"What was that?" you ask, your attention drawn away from the fire. Your fairly certain you heard something crashing in the bushes nearby.

"Probably just a 'possum," Samantha answers, not bothering to look away from the fire. "They won't come near the fire."

"No, I don't think it's a 'possum," Donna said, looking in the direction of the crashing noise. "I think I saw a flashlight or something."

Samantha stood up, her face obviously furious. "It's that creepy Bobby Winger from across the lake, trying to peep again." Yelling in the direction of the crashing noise, she yelled, "Bobby Winger, you get up here right now, or I swear I'm going to go get my grandpa's shotgun and start skeet shooting, with you as my clay pigeon."

The shout went answered for a few seconds, and you begin to wonder if maybe it was just 'possums, and the lights Donna saw were just fireflies.

Then, out of the bush steps a sight that make all four of you gasp and stare. Emerging from the darkness are
1421.title: a furry alien survey team

the rest of you go to sleep while Masumi waits for Pakhal's return
1422.content:
His name was Pakhal, a young male of the Alilal race. Like you, he had just recently graduated his race's version of high school. As is the tradition of his people, he went on a solo journey, though he took his in space. He hadn't meant to land on Earth, but a faulty energy source and a little panicking by a new pilot ended up with an emergency landing on Earth in the woods near the cabin you and your friends are staying in.

Of course, you didn't learn this right away. But that was because your first reaction at seeing Pakhal was to scream.

You were sitting at the fire, debating about making one more s'more for yourself before the four of you called it a night, when you happened to look up.

You saw the face of a giant calico cat looking back down at you.

Your natural reaction was to scream and point.

What you didn't expect was the owner of the giant cat face to scream in reply and disappear back into the woods.

Naturally your three friends looked up to where you were pointing. The giant cat face had disappeared by the time they had looked up, but they heard the giant scream of fright, same as you.

Before any of you could start exchanging information, a voice that sounded like the low rumble of distant thunder, with an inexplicable clipped British accent, called out from the woods.

"I'm really friendly," the voice promised. "I won't hurt you if you don't hurt me. Can I come out?"

You and the rest of your friends are absolutely stunned at the whole chain of events. But even more surprising is the fact that it's shy Masumi who calls it, "We're friendly too. Come on out."

And that's when you get your first view of Pakhal.

For all practical purposes, Pakhal looks like a calico tabby cat that someone tried to turn into a human being. A giant human being. Pakhal looks to be at least sixty foot tall. And no tail. Which might be a good thing, considering what kind damage a swinging, twitching giant tale could do.

Pakhal was wearing a form fitting blue bodysuit as he emerged from the woods. He was crouching, and you could tell he was trying to express through his body language that he was harmless.

He came to the edge of the light of the fire and knelt down. Masumi walked out to him as if talking with giant aliens was something she did every day. Maybe it's all the science fiction she reads and watches all the time. You don't know. But it''s Masumi who ends up taking the lead and getting everyone relaxed, both human and alien.

That's when Pakhal begins telling the four of you all about life among the stars. There's sort of a loose confederation of races that accept general rules in dealing with each other, and keeping their hands off developing races like humans. Pakhal also tells you the Alilal are the only giant race among the space faring races, with everyone else being more or less human size.

Two things you notice when Pakhal is talking. First, all his teeth are flat. He might look like a feline, but he doesn't have a mouth full of sharp teeth like you would expect from a feline.

This makes sense when you find out the Alilal are strictly herbivores. Well, they like fish too, but fish don't agree with their digestive systems. So no giant sushi for Pakhal!

You also notice Pakhal got very comfortable with Masumi very quickly. You, Donna and Samantha eventually relax enough in the surreal situation to talk to Pakhal, but he seems intensely shy with everyone except Masumi, You suspect that back on his planet, Masumi might be the giant male feline version of Masumi. Maybe that, combined with Masumi's love of Syfy, is the reason she and Pakhal are able to get along with each other.

You learn that, as big as Pakhal's one man craft is (it's the size of a Boeing 757), the technology built into it let it land undetected. He asks if he can move it next to the cabin, and promises the technology will keep it hidden from sight or technology. Since the cabin belongs to Samantha's family, you and the other girls look to her to answer. She agrees to Pakhal's proposal, much to Masumi's delight.

It's getting late, and Pakhal says it'll take about half an hour to move his craft. By mutual consent,
1422.title: a sixty foot alien feline with a pescatarian diet

14221.content:
Among the many, many weird things that are happening tonight is the interaction between Pakhal and Masumi. Okay, not open flirting, but the kind of flirting two shy people do when they like each other. It would be kind of cute, and you might even encourage it, and try to fade into the background, if it weren't for the fact that Pakhal is an alien who is almost twelve times as tall as the rest of you.

The spaceship isn't quite invisible. It's sort of this shapeless, heat shimmer thing as it emerges from the water. Pakhal "parks" it by the cabin's deck, and then it truly does become invisible. Pakhal promises to give everyone a tour the following morning. Masumi is excited about the whole thing---you all are, but she especially is---but the promise of a tour tomorrow morning seems to mollify her. With that promise, you all head to sleep, including Pakhal.

That night

"What the heck is that?" you ask, as you see a light approaching the cabin from over the lake.

"It's Greg Stone's fucking drone," Samantha growled, standing up. "I'm sorry, I know we don't use that kind of language," she told Masumi. "But he's always flying that thing around and bothering everyone and always trying to take pictures. I'm going to go get my Grandma's skeet gun and blow it out of the sky."

"I don't think that's a drone," Donna said as the light got closer.

"Helicopter?" you suggest, though there doesn't seem to be any noise associated with the light.

"Whatever it is, why don't we step inside until it passes," Samantha suggests. The rest of you agree, but you're barely out of your chairs when the light grows super bright, then everything turns dark.

145.content:
Your name is Bethany Wilson, age 19. You had long, chestnut-brown hair, hazel-blue eyes, and an excellent figure to match. You had an outgoing attitude, and was always friendly toward others. You lived on a small ranch near Dallas, Texas with your mother.

Unfortunately, things had been pretty rough for you lately. After your father had walked out on you, your mother had turned to drinking in order to drown her sorrows. Plus, you were facing foreclosure on the farmland. You were hoping for some way to turn your life around somehow.

You were walking through the woods near the farm late one evening. You wished for some way to disappear and escape from your current life. Suddenly,
145.title: Bethany

1451.content:
You were racking your brains to figure out a way to save the ranch, but unfortunately, you didn't live in a the world of a feel good Hallmark movie. This was real life. You had been abandoned by your father.

Scratch that, you had been abandoned by both your parents. Your father had abandoned you by driving off in his truck, while your mother had abandoned you by diving into a tequila bottle.

You were walking on the back side of your ranch, where it was mostly wooded, and considered just walking away from everything. Your mother was only worried about herself, why shouldn't you do the same? You could go into town, get a student grant, study at the community college for a couple of years and get an associate degree. Or maybe you could do something like join the Coast Guard. There were a lot of options to consider, rather than just hanging around a ranch that nobody else seemed interested in saving.

All these thoughts were running through your head when a streaking light shot through the sky in front of you. It was followed by a boom that literally knocked you on your ass,

When you got up, there was no sign of where that streaking light had landed/crashed. No sign of smoke rising from the distance, nothing.

But you still have an idea of where it landed. Your ranch (which is about an hour northwest of Dallas) butts up on the west to a national forest, and you don't think whatever that white light was landed too far on the other side of the boundary.

You get to the aged barbed wire marking the boundary of the national forest, with signs from the 1960s declaring it as such. You climb over the barbed wire fence, head through a thick cluster of pines, and emerge in a small meadow. In the small meadow, you see it. It's a metal capsule or vessel or orb or something. There are no markings of any kind on the capsule to indicate who it belongs to. No rivets or doors or anything. Just a smooth oblong metallic something or other which is
1451.title: Something crash lands in the field nearby

run like hell to get as far away as possible
14513.content:
You look in amazement at the huge structure in front of you, sitting in the meadow. There are no doors or openings on it. Just smooth metal. You can't even see where whatever it was assembled or welded or whatever. It's just nothing but shiny smooth metal.

And that's not all. It's just sitting there in the middle of the field, as if someone had flown it in by helicopter and gently set it down. There are no burn marks or ruts in the dirt, Nothing. There are wildflowers all around it, totally undisturbed.

And where are all the rescue helicopters and fire engines and search airplanes. Something like this drops in, especially with a major city being only an hour away, and you'd think someone official would take nothing. But it's perfectly quiet. No approaching sirens or any other noises.

You stand there in other befuddlement when suddenly a square appears in the middle of the metal vessel. A huge fucking square.

You
